comment: Great choice for physics II lab, if you show up, do your lab marginally well and turn it in on time youll get an A. Hes willing to answer any questions you may have during lab and he drops the lowest lab grade. I cant speak for his lecture but a solid choice for lab.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great lab professor. Literally if you show up, do the lab, right down some numbers that look correct and turn it in, you'll get a 100. One lab is dropped and if you don't miss any, you can miss the last lab. Didn't miss one, turned in all the labs and made a 100

Lecture basically consists of him reading through the textbook as fast as humanly possible and copying the formulas already found in the textbook onto the white board. Lecture is pretty much useless unless you're illiterate. The homework is also pretty difficult and is absolutely nothing like his tests (our class avg on the first test was a 57%).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr. Johnson is the perfect lab professor. He works through the entire lab with the students because some of the setups are hard. He will also collect his own data which you can compare to yours. Super enthusiastic and very helpful. Got an A giving the bare minimum.

Very smart and passionate professor. I only wish the school had given him better resources. A lot of the physics department uses the same lousy textbook, but Dr. Johnson at least makes it easier to understand.

Very passionate and says from the start that lab should be fun for everyone. Unfortunately, he fell ill and I only had him for 3 weeks, but I'd take him as a lab professor for sure anytime. Great guy, easy grades. He's super fun and he loves what he does, which is obvious in his role as an instructor. Take him for lab.
Dr. Johnson is a very entertaining and enthusiastic lab professor. I 100% recommend his lab. He isn't strict in his grading, and makes the lab enjoyable.
Dr. Johnson is knowledgeable and enthusiastic about physics. He genuinely cares about his students, and he is willing to help outside of class. He's a little goofy, which makes class enjoyable.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: He's not the best professor I've ever had, but he's definitely not the worst. Summer semester was his second semester teaching and he's started to get the hang of it. If you go to class everyday, he is willing to work with you. You don't even have to pay attention, he recognizes students who put effort into his class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Prof Johnson is a pretty nice guy, but the class was admittedly a mess. It was his first time teaching in a while. Unclear expectations. There was a heavy curve. If you're reading this in 2018 or beyond, he's probably fine. WebAssign hw, lowest test grade dropped. Cheat sheets allowed on tests. You'll be teaching yourself for the most part.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I literally learned more from reading the textbook. Rarely went to class because he is so confusing to listen to and watch. He teaches from ready made slides from the book and complains most of the time on how poorly they are made.

It was his first semester teaching but the guy didn't start out great. He seems nice enough but he isn't a great teacher. He was very unorganized and didn't seem to know the material well. Spent lots of class time complaining about the textbook and "readymade" slides. That being said if you want to teach yourself the material his tests are doable.

I'll cut the guy some slack.  It was his first year teaching and he wasn't too bad.  Tests are really long, but he chooses the middle of the road difficult ones.  Do the HW by yourself and study, and you should be fine.  He isn't so bad, but if you can find an experienced teacher, go for it.

Very poor at explaining topics. Very unorganized and is unfocused on the criteria. Stressed out at every class and it translates to stressing students out. Seems like a nice guy, and knows a lot about Physics, but not good at teaching. His tests are too long for the time allotted and his grading style is scattered.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Johnson is an okay physics instructor. You really need to learn  a lot from the textbook because he does not explain concepts too well. The first test he grades easy, but after that it gets much harder.
